objective: To train candidates on disaster preparedness, response, recovery, and mitigation strategies for different types of disasters.

modules.title: Introduction to Disaster Management
topics: Disaster Management Cycle: Mitigation, Preparedness, Response, Recovery
Roles and responsibilities of individuals and communities
Overview of NDMA, NDRF, and local authorities
precautions: Always stay informed about disaster alerts from official sources
Prepare a family emergency plan and practice it regularly

modules.title: Earthquake Preparedness
topics: Safety measures during and after an earthquake
Structural safety and retrofitting of buildings
precautions: Do not run during tremors; Drop, Cover, and Hold
Avoid standing near windows, mirrors, and heavy furniture
After shaking stops, move to open space safely
Keep emergency kits ready (torch, water, first aid, radio)

modules.title: Flood Safety and Management
topics: Early warning systems and evacuation routes
precautions: Avoid walking or driving through floodwaters
Move valuables and documents to higher places
Disconnect electrical appliances during floods
Drink only clean or boiled water after flooding

modules.title: Fire Safety and Evacuation
topics: How to use a fire extinguisher (PASS method)
Fire prevention in residential and workplace areas
precautions: Do not use elevators during fire emergencies
Crawl low under smoke to avoid inhalation
Know at least two exit routes from any building
Regularly inspect electrical wiring and gas connections

modules.title: Cyclone and Storm Preparedness
topics: Identifying safe shelters and cyclone-resistant structures
precautions: Stay indoors during heavy winds
Secure loose items outside the house
Store food, water, and medicines for at least 3 days
Avoid standing near glass windows during storms

modules.title: Industrial and Chemical Disaster Response
topics: Decontamination and first-aid for chemical exposure
precautions: Avoid direct contact with spilled chemicals
Cover nose and mouth with wet cloth during gas leaks
Follow evacuation routes marked by safety teams
Never re-enter affected areas until declared safe

modules.title: Mock Drills, Assessment, and Certification
topics: Practical drills for earthquake, fire, and flood
Use of rescue tools and first-aid kits
precautions: Take all drills seriously â€” treat them as real scenarios
Listen carefully to instructions from coordinators
Maintain calm and help others during exercises

assessment.passingCriteria: Minimum 70% in quiz and full participation in drills
assessment.certification: Certificate of Disaster Preparedness and Response

importantNotes: Every trainee must complete all modules to receive certification.
Attendance is mandatory for at least 90% of total sessions.
Medical fitness certificate may be required for field activities.
Emergency contact numbers should be saved by all trainees.
